title: BABY SHOES
author: BABY SHOES
content: After reading today's news about the Cold Wallet Movie it was a very curious concern for me because I wanted to watch this movie after reading the story at length in this article:I am not explaining more but you can see this article about Cold Wallet Movie and its story.Source: https://decrypt.co/228289/cold-wallet-review-first-real-crypto-filmAfter reading from the Indiewire article it will premiere at the 2024 SXSW Film & TV Festival on March 8, well what I'm curious about here is have any of you watched it? I only saw the 1 minute tailer.Has this movie aired on other movie platforms such as Netflix and others? If there is I will watch it even though it has to be paid.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: I just watched the teaser trailer too, looks like a fun heist flick with a crypto twist!  Just like you, I havent heard of it being on any streaming platforms yet (Netflix, Hulu, etc.).  There is no official word yet on a wider release.  Sometimes these festival films take a while to find a home on streaming platforms.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: Quote from: BABY SHOES on April 27, 2024, 08:21:54 PMHas this movie aired on other movie platforms such as Netflix and others? If there is I will watch it even though it has to be paid.I think that it will only be available for public viewing on the different movie platforms after it has been aired first on the movie festival. I think that's how it works. The feeling of loss, anger, frustration and other emotions experienced by the actors in the movie who invested in crypto is very relatable to anyone who has lost money in any crypto exchange. I am eager to see this movie. In my mind, I have given the trailer a 3/10. I'll add it up with my rating of the complete movie when I see it.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: This ain't bad, at least, compared from the previous crypto movies I heard of. QuoteAfter a crypto exchange collapses, a group of Redditors set out to recover their funds from the CEO—by whatever means necessary.I might actually watch this if the opportunity arises but it looks like an indie film to me so I'm not expecting major streaming platforms to pick this up unless this blew up or something. Do keep us updated if you find any online platforms, @op or anyone here lol.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on April 27, 2024, 09:42:50 PMThis ain't bad, at least, compared from the previous crypto movies I heard of. I don't think there has been a truly great crypto movie yet, either.  Maybe it's hard to capture the fast-paced, ever-changing nature of the space in a traditional film format.  It's a complex story to tell!  Maybe Hollywood is still figuring it out.Speaking of, have you seen any crypto-related ones that you actually enjoyed?  I'd love to hear some recommendations

comments.body: Quite a weird and bland movie title that doesn't even spark a bit of interest, even with me — someone who's so into this kind of shit.Anyway, at the very least this trailer shows how freakin important it is to be private with your crypto holdings. comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Qitqqe on April 28, 2024, 07:24:35 PMIs bitcoin core a cold wallet?Not sure how this relates to this topic(a movie lol), but if you installed it on an air-gapped device running a secure open-source Linux OS like Tails, then sure. Otherwise, no.If you don't know what you're doing, just purchase a Ledger or Trezor hardware wallet. Don't complicate it.

Hardware store villains The trailer isn't that bad, pretty normal for a b movie. I've seen worse than that. More or less the same genre as Don't Breathe, just worse budget, fresh actors and all that. Probably going to be disappointing, but I like thrillers and I'd watch it if there was nothing better. As for the safety of your home, most of us underestimate it until they have to really face a burglary or an invasion. Then we hope we had that lock on bedroom's door, or a video camera, but it's too late. These things usually happen only once in our lives and you either are prepared or not. Buying all that stuff after the fact won't make much difference.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: The first real crypto movie? I was almost tempted to watch it until I saw the word "heist". At least Dope semi-described what Silk Road might have looked like for some people but why does a Bitcoin movie always have to have an element of crime attached?I suppose the story of buway the guy who finally found a way to conduct business and send money home without restrictions is too boring for a "real crypto film".
